Title: Data Analyst
text:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

 

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Greece.
Analytical mindset. 

Job Requirements

 

Must be living in Greece for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.  

Technical requirements to perform the work

 

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:

-       A logon account unique to you

-       Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed

-    Only one member per household may apply

  NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

 

Benefits

 

· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

 

Apply Online Today!

  

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Title: Software Engineer (Backend)
text:
Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.




If you love writing code to solve complex, big data problems, then Cision Engineering is the place for you. We seek engineers who are passionate about building complete, production-quality software services, with a scalable and sustainable architecture and implementation, with high performance over large data sets, and with low latency and high availability.




We have a diverse organization with engineers across the globe. We are solving challenging and interesting problems offer to innovate, influence, transform, inspire and grow!




What You Will Be Doing




Delivering web experiences that are highly crafted and rewarding to the Public Relations and Marketing community.
Collaborating with web design, and product teams to ensure the goals of the product are aligned with the delivered feature or service.
Deliver experiences that are user-focused and adhere to accessibility standards.
Work with the product development team in driving innovative approaches to solving complex problems.
Maintain code standards regarding quality, privacy, accessibility, security,




Skills And Experience




Proficiency in high level languages such as Java or C#
Experience in an agile scrum or kanban processes
Strong analytical problem-solving skills.
Good knowledge of fundamental engineering concepts, understanding good software architecture/design, algorithms, data structures, writing modular and testable code.
Understanding of the full web stack, from databases to server-side code to the quirks of cross-browser compatibility.
Experience with system architecture and design.
Experience with highly scalable systems.
Good knowledge of large-scale distributed systems and client-server architectures.
Good knowledge and experience with messaging, eventing technologies, pub/sub services.
Understanding of SQL, especially Postgres or MySQL, is a plus.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.
3+ years professional software experience.
Experience developing web or mobile applications.




Technologies We Use




Java, Python, C#, Ruby
Spring, Spring Boot, Rails
PostgreSQL, MySQLp
Git, Github Actions
Terraform, GCP, AWS




As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.




Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .




Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.




Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com




Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

Title: Fullstack Software Engineer - Cloud / DevOps / Git / Home Office (m/w/d)
text:
Als Fullstack Software Engineer (m/w/d) bist du ein wesentlicher Baustein unseres technologischen Fortschritts. Du formst und implementierst wegweisende Softwarelösungen, die sowohl die Geschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden als auch unsere internen Abläufe revolutionieren.




Dein breit gefächertes Aufgabenspektrum erstreckt sich von der Beratung unserer Kund:innen, über das Entwickeln maßgeschneiderter Softwarelösungen zur Bewältigung komplexer Anforderungen, bis hin zur aktiven Mitgestaltung unserer Produktentwicklung. In jeder Rolle nutzt du deine Expertise und Kreativität, um die Herausforderungen von heute in die Lösungen von morgen zu verwandeln.

Du sprichst fließend Deutsch

Du hast solide Kenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache und Erfahrung in der Webentwicklung mit einem SPA-Webframework

Title: Software Engineer - Talent Science
text:
The role of a Software Engineer - Talent Science at Canonical




We are seeking a software engineer, passionate about improving the hiring process by delivering productivity initiatives using analytics and data science. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make significant contributions through high-quality code while exhibiting technical leadership, exceptional design, and intuitive project documentation.




As a Software Engineer focused on recruitment, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining a variety of web architecture, system integration and data science products. Building new hiring tools, dashboards and supporting analytics to enrich the hiring pipeline, enabling everyone at Canonical to make better decisions and deliver better work. You will work closely with the best and brightest developers within our company, ensuring that the solutions we build are well crafted, easy to use and scale to production workloads.




Location: This is a globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Write high-quality, well-designed software
Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
Database design and architecture for connected systems
Providing tooling to support optimised processes
Work remotely from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events




What we are looking for in you




Experience writing backend programming in Python and Node.JS
Experience with Application Tracking Systems (ideally Greenhouse) or HR IT products.
Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with Data analytics and statistical analysis
Experience with Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning
Experience with Data visualisation
Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including system design
Experience integrating with system APIs
Strong database design and architecture experience




The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow's tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the practice of recruitment and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of joining Canonical.




What we offer you




Remote first: 100% remote working with the opportunity to travel to Sprints. We meet a couple of times a year in interesting places all around the world to come together to collaborate. These Sprints see circa 300 people come together. This year we have travelled to Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Montreal and Prague!
Personal development: Annual budget allowance of 2,000 USD per annum and time to focus on areas you want to improve.
Compensation: eligibility for annual pay review including bonuses.
Recognition: The ability to be rewarded and recognised by others for the work you do.
Travel: Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues. Priority Pass for lounge access when flying to sprints. International SOS membership to support you whilst travelling.




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Dein breit gefächertes Aufgabenspektrum erstreckt sich von der Beratung unserer Kund:innen, über das Entwickeln maßgeschneiderter Softwarelösungen zur Bewältigung komplexer Anforderungen, bis hin zur aktiven Mitgestaltung unserer Produktentwicklung. In jeder Rolle nutzt du deine Expertise und Kreativität, um die Herausforderungen von heute in die Lösungen von morgen zu verwandeln.




Was erwartet dich?




Du berätst unsere Kunden und entwickelst maßgeschneiderte Softwarelösungen
Du gestaltest aktiv unsere Produktentwicklung mit
Du setzt deine Expertise und Kreativität ein, um heutige Herausforderungen in morgige Lösungen zu verwandeln




Was solltest du mitbringen?




Du sprichst fließend Deutsch
Du bist erfahren in sowohl Front-End- als auch Back-End-Entwicklung
Du hast einen besonderen Fokus auf Angular, Cloud Computing (Azure, AWS), C# oder Java, Datenbanken und Service-Architekturen
Du bist offen für Neues, ein Teamplayer und hast Interesse daran, neue Technologien zu erforschen und dich regelmäßig weiterzubilden
Du hast solide Kenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache und Erfahrung in der Webentwicklung mit einem SPA-Webframework




Was bieten wir dir?




Sehr gute Work-Life-Balance und 30 Tage Urlaub
Hoher Remote-Office-Anteil möglich
Gute Standortanbindung an öffentliche Verkehrsmittel und Autobahn
Klimatisierte Büros und kostenfreier Kaffee, Tee & Wasser vor Ort
Vertrauensarbeitszeit und Gleitzeitkonto
Bezahlte Weiterbildungen und Zertifikate
Zeit für persönliche Weiterentwicklung und Community/Research-Projekte nach Absprache

Title: Inżynier danych
text:
Data Engineer (Remote)

B2B: 100–155 PLN netto/h (~16.8k–26.0k PLN/m)

4code Sp. z o.o.




Kim jesteśmy?

4code is an Innovation Technology & Consulting company focused on secure software and product development. Connecting with the shared core values of Courage / Delivery / People / Trust, we work with technology that makes a difference and has a tangible impact on everyone's life, proudly being part of business and digital transformations.




Combining cutting-edge technology, people's talent, and innovation, we create end-to-end robust software solutions that help our clients accelerate their business development with the latest technology advances.




4code makes secure coding a positive and engaging experience for developers as they increase their skills. We guide each coder along their own preferred learning pathway, so that security-skilled developers become the everyday heroes of our connected world. Business impact is driven through agile teams awareness, S-SDLC process optimization and maturity model roadmap and metrics introduction.

‍

We succeed through a human approach that uncovers the secure developer inside of every coder - helping development teams ship quality code faster, so they can focus on creating amazing, safe software for our world.




Czym będziesz się zajmować?

Project:

The engineer will complement the team of Data Engineers operating for one of the client's business areas (new DRDI functionalities).

Activities include developing the area of data management using Azure services - this is part of the client's digital transformation.

Technology stack: Azure Databricks, SQL, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL BD, Azure Devops, Python, PySpark, CI/CD




Tasks:

● Developing new functionalities in the area of DRDI,

● Designing and building pipelines using appropriate frameworks,

● Cooperation with a team of Data Engineers in conducting POCs, proposing solutions, suggesting improvements,

● Creation/Maintenance/Management of environments for advanced analytical processes,

● Tracking patterns of data use and consumption, cooperation with members of other teams responsible for working with data (their training and support in the field of Azure DB)

● Developing standards and good practices for data engineering processes.




Kogo poszukujemy?

Required:

● min. 2+ years of experience as a Data Engineer,

● comfortable programming in Java and Spark or Scala,

● working knowledge of rest/micro-services solutions in a distributed architecture(Java),

● Azure DataBricks (very good knowledge), Azure DataFactory (good knowledge), Azure SQL DB, Azure DevOps, CI/CD

● good knowledge of SQL or other database languages,

● familiar with Linux at least on the level of Bash scripting,

● you communicate freely in English.

● Occasional Workshop visits in Warsaw (once per month)




Nice to have:

● Knowledge of parallel processing algorithms/techniques, Spring Boost 2.0 / Spring Cloud,

● knowledge of BigData / distributed computing,

● Familiarity with K8S, Docker, DeltaLake, DataMesh, Areospike, AirFlow, Vertica

● Knowledge of data warehousing / data warehouse system solutions.




Czego wymagamy?

Azure DataBricks
Azure Data Factory
SQL
Azure SQL DB
CI/CD




Mile widziane:

pytest
Scala




Języki:

Polski
Angielski




Jakie warunki i benefity otrzymasz?

100-155 PLN miesięcznie (B2B)
B2B - Elastyczne godziny pracy (100%)
Praca zdalna: W całości
Budżet szkoleniowy, Szkolenia wewnętrzne
Pakiet medyczny, Ubezpieczenie

Title: System Engineer - Internal IT
text:
Who are we looking for?




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the worlds leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We're energised by an inclusive and responsive organisational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organisation. Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organisation. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch peoples lives.




We are looking for an IT System Engineer with at least 4 years of experience to join Netcentric's Internal IT team. You are a good fit if you consider yourself as a team player who is looking forward to operating and constantly improving secure high-available Systems.




If this sounds like you, we need to talk.




This role is open for remote work only from Romania.




Your role:




Perform changes around the Engineering Systems
Monitor and troubleshoot the Engineering Systems
Propose ideas and execute improvements based on metrics and best practices
Work closely with the internal client for troubleshooting
Plan and test backup, recovery and restore procedures scenarios
Compensated on-call duty rotation





What we require:




Ability to work autonomously
Strong verbal and written English skills
Team oriented person
Linux administration and scripting experience
Solid understanding of networking and protocols
Experience in AWS administration, Google Cloud or Azure
Configuration Management tools such as Puppet, Ansible or Chef
Provisioning tools such as Foreman
Continuous Integration tools such as Git, Bitbucket, Jenkins or Nexus
Monitoring tools such as Zabbix, Grafana or Prometheus
Strong focus on automating common tasks





What makes us smile when looking at your profile:




Web applications experience with tools such as Apache, Nginx or Tomcat
Administration of Atlassian product suite (Jira, Confluence, Crowd, Bitbucket)
AWS CSA or
LFCE, RedHat or LPIC certification
Network Security or Cybersecurity certification





At Cognizant Netcentric you get:




Centrally located office in Timpuri Noi with great fitout and standing desks
Remote/hybrid friendly environment
Flexible working hours
Apple work equipment (WFH equipment and Welcome package)
International and dynamic team
Private medical subscription
Sponsored Gym Membership (WorldClass/7Card)
Employee Assistance Program
Wellbeing Programs: Yoga, Mindfulness, etc.
Meal vouchers
Peer recognition bonus system (Bonus.ly) - makes it easy and fun to get and give recognition to colleagues for their work and accomplishments
Referral bonus
Vacation: 22 days + 1 additional day per calendar year in the company (maximum 30 days/year)
Extended winter holidays: days off on December 24th and 31st
Paid sick days: 3 per year
Training, certification and conference attendance based on personal development goals
Company events: our annual company summit, summer and Christmas parties, skiing event (in compliance with local restrictions)
Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization

Title: Software Engineer II - Hosting Applications (Remote)
text:
Job Description




Are you a skilled developer looking to join a creative team? Do you have commercial experience with Angular, .Net, PostgreSQL, and MSSQL? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to work on the Nebula project!




Our team is looking for developers that can help us develop and maintain our dockerized services responsible for analyzing and modifying spreadsheets and audio files. You'll also have the chance to work on parallel Angular web modules accountable for viewing and redacting audio files, spreadsheet documents, and HTML files.




As a member of our team, you'll have a chance to work on test automation, participate in code reviews, and ensure the quality and capability of our existing software while helping to create new features and functionalities. If you're ready for an ambitious and productive role in a dynamic and innovative environment, we encourage you to apply today!




If you would like to learn more about the Nebula, check this link https://www.ediscovery.com/




Remote, work from home opportunity.




Qualifications




3 + years of experience in .NET/C#
Good knowledge in Frontend technologies HTML/CSS, Angular/TypeScript
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Focus on continuous improvements
Excellent communication skills
Being a team player
Good knowledge of English
SQL databases, preferably PostgreSQL
NoSQL Databases, preferably SOLR
ASP. Net Core
Docker
PowerShell
Linux, Bash




Development Opportunities We Offer




Conferences in Poland
Industry-specific e-learning platforms
Intracompany training
Mentoring
Technical knowledge exchange within the company




What We Offer




Employment contract
Mentoring program and language lessons
Opportunity to develop your skills (trainings, conferences, books and more)
Attractive package of benefits, i.e., contribution of costs of a private medical care (Medicover) and a sports card (Multisport)
Good coffee & Sweet Mondays
Refer a friend, earn a bonus!
See more here: https://www.ontrack.com/pl-pl/engineering/




To Apply: Create an account login and apply here.




Our Cultural Values




We Seek Team Members Who Are




Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision.




Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients’ needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses
Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact
Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients




Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers.




Who We Are




KLDiscovery provides technology-enabled services and software to help law firms, corporations, government agencies and consumers solve complex data challenges. The company, with offices in 25 locations across 16 countries, is a global leader in delivering best-in-class eDiscovery, information governance and data recovery solutions to support the litigation, regulatory compliance, internal investigation and data recovery and management needs of our clients.




Serving clients for over 30 years, KLDiscovery offers data collection and forensic investigation, early case assessment, electronic discovery and data processing, application software and data hosting for web-based document reviews, and managed document review services. In addition, through its global Ontrack Data Recovery business, KLDiscovery delivers world-class data recovery, email extraction and restoration, data destruction and tape management.




KLDiscovery has been recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in North America by both Inc. Magazine (Inc. 5000) and Deloitte (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500) and CEO Chris Weiler has been honored as a past Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year™. Additionally, KLDiscovery is an Orange-level Relativity Best in Service Partner, a Relativity Premium Hosting Partner and maintains ISO/IEC 27001 Certified data centers.




KLDiscovery is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Software Engineer
text:
About Alcon




Alcon is the global leader in eye care, dedicated to helping people see brilliantly. With our 70-plus-year heritage, we are the largest eye care device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care. Being a truly global company, we work in over 70 countries and serve patients in more than 140 countries.




What You Will Do/ Responsibilities




In this role you will act as the Full Stack Solution Designer for a key strategic initiative (s) within Alcon Digital Health leveraging significant enterprise experience in architecture and hands-on delivery of solutions to achieve business outcomes. This includes having the strong ability to look around the corner at emerging technologies and advise senior leadership around the strategic technical vision for the tower. You will play a key role in furthering the modernization journey for Alcon Digital team to achieve new heights.




Cradle to Grave Solution Leadership: Provide expert oversight and leadership throughout the lifecycle of solutions within a designated domain, guiding solution engineers and architects in navigating application architectures.
Buy vs Build Analysis: Conduct thorough analysis, both quantitative and qualitative, to determine whether to buy or build solutions, offering a well-reasoned recommendation.
Architecture and Design Reviews: Play a pivotal role in architecture design reviews, identifying gaps and recommending changes, and actively engage with the Architecture community to drive digital technology modernization.
Reference Architecture and Implementation: Lead and mentor domain architects in developing cloud-native application reference architectures and implementations.
Application profile identification: Leverage significant technical expertise and domain knowledge to identify Alcon apps targeted for refactor and optimization for cloud.
Proof of concept technology support: Lead and drive proofs-of-concept and technology deep-dives specific to partner technologies
“Roll up your sleeves and help clear technical roadblocks”: Advise and assist App development teams with technical roadblocks such as performance challenges within a solution.
Cost optimization identification: Engage with appropriate stakeholders to recommend or assess opportunities to drive cost efficiencies aimed at simplicity, configurability and eventual elimination of technical debt associated with PSS applications.




What are we looking for in a successful candidate?




Technical Expertise: Possess outstanding technical subject matter expertise and extensive domain knowledge in the relevant field.
Cloud Architecture: Demonstrate SME-level understanding of cloud design and architecture for major public cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP) to deliver large-scale distributed solutions spanning the entire enterprise stack.
Diverse Technical Skills: Exhibit SME-level technical proficiency in various domains, including application and integration architecture, security, automation, and IT operations, along with an essential grasp of APIs and microservices-based architecture.
Domain-Driven Design Proficiency: Expertise in mapping domain scope to Bounded Contexts/Microservices, conducting Event Storming for strategic design definition, and formulating roadmaps based on value realization.
Modern Tech Integration: Experience working with technologies that bridge modern applications with legacy infrastructure, particularly leveraging streaming platforms.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to collaborate effectively with Digital, IT, Enterprise Architecture, Operations, and Security teams to deliver comprehensive solutions. Proficiency in enterprise development tools and methodologies, including XP, Agile, DevSecOps, and DataOps.
Coding Skills: A hands-on technologist with coding proficiency and expertise in modern technology stacks such as Cloud, DevOps, Angular, Java, React, and familiarity with both SQL and NoSQL database technologies.
Practical Experience: Demonstrable hands-on experience in implementing and executing solutions in the relevant areas. Capability to facilitate the adoption of cloud-native and cloud-first architectures, including integrating with legacy mainframe/mid-range AS400 applications and developing modernization roadmaps for legacy applications.




It would be a plus if you have.




Ability to teach and upskill talent within the organization.
Thought leadership and mentoring.
Excellent communication
Deep collaboration skills. Ability to work as a team player seeking alignment and able to influence outcomes through hands-on demonstration of cloud capabilities.




What we can offer you:




Very competitive salary level with flexible contract options.
Market-leading performance based annual bonus.
Attractive package of benefits.
Possibility to grow your own team and introduce engineering best practices.
Opportunity to work in a high paced agile environment and the chance to work with people who are passionate of delivering outcomes and a culture of simplification and ownership.
Flexible working hours and remote work possibilities.

Title: IT System Engineer - Cloud / Microsoft 365 Services / Home Office (m/w/d)
text:
Bitte füge Deiner Bewerbung alle relevanten Bewerbungsunterlagen als eine gesammelte Datei hinzu.




Was erwartet dich?




Du analysierst Kundenanforderungen und stellst kundenspezifische Lösungen auf Basis von Outlook bereit
Du berätst und schulst zu Microsoft Cloud-Anwendungen wie Teams, OneDrive, Whiteboard, OneNote, Tasks, Planner, ToDo und anderen
Du entwickelst Lösungen, um die Anwendungen zu verbessern
Du behebst Fehler, analysierst Probleme und führst Tests durch, um die reibungslose Funktion der M365-Anwendungen zu gewährleisten
Du unterstützt Endanwender:innen
Du konzipierst und definierst KPIs und erstellst zugehörige Berichte




Was solltest du mitbringen?




Du hast mindestens 3 Jahre nachweisbare Berufserfahrung im Bereich Microsoft 365
Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in den Studiengängen Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Informatik, (Techno-)Mathematik, Fachinformatik (z.B. Medizin, Physik) oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Du verfügst über umfassende Kenntnisse in Microsoft Cloud-Anwendungen wie Teams, OneDrive, Whiteboard, OneNote, Task, Planner und ToDo
Du besitzt idealerweise Kenntnisse zur Microsoft Power Plattform sowie ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten, bist fähig zur Zusammenarbeit im Team und begeisterungsfähig
Du beherrschst Deutschkenntnisse auf C1- oder C2-Niveau und gute Englischkenntnisse




Was bieten wir dir?




Ein dynamisches, motiviertes Team
Flache Hierarchien und eine kollegiale Arbeitsatmosphäre
Unterstützung Deiner Weiterentwicklung
Strukturierte Einarbeitung mit Mentor
Remote Arbeit - gemeinsam finden wir für dich das perfekte Arbeitsmodell
Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung mit Kernarbeitszeiten
Vergünstigte Fortbewegungsangebote
Einen Bonus für deine geleistete Arbeit: uns ist es wichtig, dich am Erfolg des Unternehmens teilhaben zu lassen!
Teamevents




Bewerbungsprozess




Du erhältst innerhalb von 24 Stunden eine Rückmeldung
Du wirst eine Testaufgabe bearbeiten
Wenn wir uns entscheiden, weiterzumachen, erhältst du ein Interview mit unserem leitenden Entwickler

Title: System Engineer ( DevOps)
text:
What makes Cognizant Netcentric a great fit for you?




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the world's leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We're energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization.




Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch people's lives.




This role is open for remote work only from Spain.




Your Role




Working on current platforms running on Cloud Infrastructure and Azure
Supporting delivery project team and releases in non-prod environments
Automation in CI/CD setups with Jenkins
Work with the project teams on defining runbooks for controlled deployments
Being part of system engineering team, contributing and participating in improvements
Performing deployments and testing them
Taking care of the application stack such as AEM, Varnish, ACC, Apache, SSO and more





Qualifications




Linux Administration experience
GIT and on a source code in collaborative way
Computer Networking
Continuous integration based on Jenkins, Nexus or Gitlab, ADO or other CI/CD tool
Nexus or other Artifact Repositories
Understanding of monitoring
Command Line skills, scripting (Bash)
Experience with CDN or web caching products e.g. Varnish / Akamai or AEM dispatcher
Web and Linux Security remediation experience
Web servers e.g Apache/Nginx
Application Management Experience





Nice to have:




Atlassian JIRA, Confluence and Stash
Adobe AEM administration on-prem
RedHat or LPIC Certification





At Cognizant Netcentric you can get:




Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation
Flexible working hours
Recognition bonus system
Private health insurance
Apple work equipment
WFH equipment + welcome package
WFH monthly expenses compensation
Access to Udemy courses
Adobe certification
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
A dynamic and international team
Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organization

Title: Software Engineer - Talent Science
text:
The role of a Software Engineer - Talent Science at Canonical




We are seeking a software engineer, passionate about improving the hiring process by delivering productivity initiatives using analytics and data science. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make significant contributions through high-quality code while exhibiting technical leadership, exceptional design, and intuitive project documentation.




As a Software Engineer focused on recruitment, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining a variety of web architecture, system integration and data science products. Building new hiring tools, dashboards and supporting analytics to enrich the hiring pipeline, enabling everyone at Canonical to make better decisions and deliver better work. You will work closely with the best and brightest developers within our company, ensuring that the solutions we build are well crafted, easy to use and scale to production workloads.




Location: This is a globally remote role.




What your day will look like




Write high-quality, well-designed software
Enable new processes and improve existing workflows
Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
Consistently provide high-quality code reviews to other engineers
Display technical leadership internally and within our external communities
Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Connect to many data sources and provide insightful visualisations
Database design and architecture for connected systems
Providing tooling to support optimised processes
Work remotely from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events




What we are looking for in you




Experience writing backend programming in Python and Node.JS
Experience with Application Tracking Systems (ideally Greenhouse) or HR IT products.
Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability




Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring




Experience with Data analytics and statistical analysis
Experience with Natural language processing, sentiment analysis, machine learning
Experience with Data visualisation
Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including system design
Experience integrating with system APIs
Strong database design and architecture experience




The ideal candidate will use their passion for experimentation and analytics to build tomorrow's tech organisation. This team will help us gain insights into the practice of recruitment and our talent pool, and use those insights to improve the experience of joining Canonical.




What we offer you




Remote first: 100% remote working with the opportunity to travel to Sprints. We meet a couple of times a year in interesting places all around the world to come together to collaborate. These Sprints see circa 300 people come together. This year we have travelled to Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Montreal and Prague!
Personal development: Annual budget allowance of 2,000 USD per annum and time to focus on areas you want to improve.
Compensation: eligibility for annual pay review including bonuses.
Recognition: The ability to be rewarded and recognised by others for the work you do.
Travel: Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues. Priority Pass for lounge access when flying to sprints. International SOS membership to support you whilst travelling.




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Digital Analytics Engineer - Remote Romania
text:
What makes Cognizant Netcentric a great fit for you?




At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the worlds leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ Adobe experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




Were energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization.




Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch peoples lives.




What will you do?




We are looking for a software engineer who is ready to welcome the next challenge in his/her career. The role of Analytics Engineer will allow you to use your background in software development applied to the delivery of marketing solutions for our international customers. You will play a key role in projects where you understand what business wants and translate their needs into technical solutions to support their data driven strategies. Your software engineering skills will be applied in the implementation of marketing technologies in the realm of data collection and experimentation and finding solutions to integrate them in the diverse architectural landscape of our clients.




Are you passionate about capturing data to answer burning questions from clients that want to know more about how their digital solutions are performing? Can you support digital analytics specialists with your technical knowledge on the best practices of data collection?




If this sounds like you, we need to talk.




What do we require from you?




You have a background in software engineering, development, computer science or programming skills.
Project experience around data collection, analytics, personalization
Comfortable with JavaScript, HTML, jQuery, CSS and DOM manipulation
Good knowledge of browser technologies
Operational experience with Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Google Analytics, Google Optimize.
Operational experience implementing and customizing Tag Management Solutions such as Adobe Launch, Google Tag Manager, Tealium, Pega.
Familiar with different types of Data Layer specifications, design, implementation, and consumption.
Solid technical understanding of software engineering/web development principles: iterative cycles, source control, unit testing and producing qualitative, clean code
Good understanding of web analytics and digital marketing concepts





What makes us smile when we look at your profile:




Project experience in personalisation, A/B testing, optimization
Software development experience using RESTful APIs, Node.js, NPM, React, Angular or other front-end frameworks.
Experience in international projects and working with remote teams
Not afraid to run workshop and knowledge sharing sessions





At Cognizant Netcentric you get:




Centrally located office in Timpuri Noi with great fitout and standing desks
Remote/hybrid friendly environment
Flexible working hours
Apple work equipment (WFH equipment and Welcome package)
International and dynamic team
Private medical subscription
Sponsored Gym Membership (WorldClass/7Card)
Employee Assistance Program
Wellbeing Programs: Yoga, Mindfulness, etc.
Meal vouchers (30 RON/Working Day)
Peer recognition bonus system (Bonus.ly) - makes it easy and fun to get and give recognition to colleagues for their work and accomplishments
Referral bonus
Vacation: 22 days + 1 additional day per calendar year in the company (maximum 30 days/year)
Extended winter holidays: days off on December 24th and 31st

Title: Linux System Engineer (w/m/d) Monitoring & Container Technologies
text:
Aufgabenbereich




Unser Team aus hochmotivierten Observability- und Operations-Experten sucht weitere Mitstreiter. Als Systemadministrator/in betreiben und verbessern Sie gemeinsam mit Site Reliability Engineers und Network Engineers unseren Observability Stack vom Hardware Server bis zum BGP Announcement der Service IP.




In einer Kultur, die großen Wert auf kreative Ideen, agile Arbeitsmethoden, Initiative und Partizipation legt, erwarten Sie die folgenden Aufgaben:




Sie betreuen aktiv (Bereitstellen, Betreiben, Migrieren) Services für unternehmensübergreifendes Monitoring und Reporting auf Linux und nehmen an der Rufbereitschaft teil.
Sie analysieren Probleme, beheben Incidents nach den jeweiligen ITIL-Prozessen und dokumentieren diese.
Sie aktualisieren kontinuierlich Ihr Wissen und Ihre Erfahrung im Umgang mit Linux und Netzwerktechnologien und bringen diese effektiv in das Team ein.
Sie unterstützen die Unternehmensziele durch eine effiziente Betriebsarchitektur, aktives Lifecycle-Management und schlanke Prozesse in einer agilen DevOps-Umgebung.




Qualifikationen




Wir schätzen eine strukturierte und selbständige Arbeitsweise, sowie eine offene und kooperative Kommunikation mit dem eigenen und anderen Teams.




Die Grundlage für Ihren Erfolg ist ein abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium oder eine gleichwertige Qualifikation.
2+ Jahre praktische Erfahrung in der Administration von 100+ Linux Systemen (keine spezifische Distribution) in 3+ Rechenzentren.
Erfahrung mit Monitoring-, Konfigurations-, VCS- und Visualisierungstools (Icinga2, Puppet, Ansible, git, grafana).
Vertraut mit Datenbanken, Messaging- und Metriksystemen (collectd/telegraf, rsyslog, Apache Kafka, Apache Cassandra, Metrictank, ELK).
Verständnis für moderne Softwarearchitekturen und deren Einsatz (REST, Microservices, Docker, CI/CD).
Kenntnisse von Netzwerk- und Infrastrukturdiensten (DNS, BGP, VLANs, Firewalling, IPv6).
Skripting/Programmierkenntnisse (bash, python, golang, Java, etc.).
Die Fähigkeit, mit einem internationalen Team fließend in Englisch (B2) zu kommunizieren; Deutsch ist von Vorteil.




Benefits




Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, im Homeoffice zu arbeiten.
Umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten (E-Learning, Konferenzen, Seminare, Mentoring).
Verschiedene Sozialleistungen (Rabatte auf Firmenprodukte, betriebliche Altersvorsorge).
Verschiedene Gesundheitsangebote (JobRad-Leasing, interne Gesundheits- und Sportkurse, Rabatte in Fitnessstudios).
Kostenloser Kaffee, zusätzliche Getränke und Obst in den Bürogebäuden.
Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in einem 2020 fertiggestellten Neubau mit eigener Betriebskantine.




Über IONOS




IONOS ist der führende europäische Digitalisierungs-Partner für kleine und mittlere Unternehmen (KMU). IONOS hat mehr als sechs Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden und ist mit einer weltweit verfügbaren Plattform in 18 Märkten in Europa und Nordamerika aktiv. Mit seinen Web Presence & Productivity-Angeboten agiert das Unternehmen als “One-Stop-Shop" für alle Digitalisierungs-Bedürfnisse - von Domains und Webhosting über klassische Website-Builder und Do-It-Yourself-Lösungen, von E-Commerce bis zu Online-Marketing-Tools. Darüber hinaus bietet IONOS Cloud-Lösungen für Firmen, die im Zuge der Weiterentwicklung ihres Geschäfts in die Cloud wechseln möchten.




Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von z. B. Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität, körperlichen Merkmalen, Familienstand oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht.

Title: C++ Software Engineer
text:
About us:

Protex AI is a VC-backed technology company building a privacy-preserving computer vision platform to enable proactive Health and Safety (EHS) workflows. We leverage the domain knowledge of EHS teams to help our computer vision system understand the concept of danger, preventing accidents before they occur. Every worker has the right to go home safe and healthy every day and every employer has the responsibility to provide a safe work environment. Our mission at Protex AI is to ensure that this is the case in every facility around the world by empowering EHS teams to adopt proactive safety cultures and in doing so realise an injury-free workplace.

Position Overview:

We are on the hunt for a multifaceted C++ Software Engineer with a solid background in UNIX system development and a flair for Python. The successful candidate will be responsible for optimising and building robust computer vision-based systems. Collaborating on AI-powered applications, and ensuring seamless integration from edge to cloud

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain software for UNIX-based systems using C++ and integrate with NVIDIA DeepStream for AI-driven insights.
Implement and optimise Python scripts to interface with C++ modules, ensuring smooth interoperability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Perform profiling on UNIX systems to identify bottlenecks and optimise performance.
Debug and enhance system stability and reliability.
Maintain thorough documentation on design, development, and profiling activities.
Stay abreast of the latest trends in C++, Python, and AI technologies like DeepStream.
Mentor team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.


Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience with C++ development for UNIX systems.
Proficiency in Python scripting and development.
Familiarity with UNIX system profiling tools and techniques.


Preferred Requirements:

Master's degree in a relevant field.
Hands-on experience with NVIDIA DeepStream SDK.
Familiarity with cloud systems e.g AWS, Azure etc.
Proven track record in optimising UNIX systems for performance and reliability.
Deep understanding of AI algorithms and pipelines.

Title: System Engineer Linux (m/w/d)
text:
Über uns

Kompetent, persönlich und initiativ - das ist die top itservices AG. Wir beraten Unternehmen ganzheitlich in ihren IT-Projekten und unterstützen sie durch die professionelle Vermittlung von Fach- und Führungskräften. Für Festanstellungen, Projekte oder auf Zeit. Nehmen Sie die Herausforderung an und besetzen Sie eine vakante Position bei einem führenden Unternehmen der Informationstechnologie als System Engineer Linux (m/w/d).

Ihre Aufgaben

Verantwortung für den Betrieb und die Weiterentwicklung einer komplexen Server-Infrastruktur mit dem Schwerpunkt Linux
Konzeption und Installation von On Premises sowie von Cloud-Projekten, -Lösungen und -Produkten

Einrichtung und Unterstützung der Systeme sowie die Dokumentation technischer Sachverhalte

Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung, Studium oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation im IT-Bereich

Know-how im Linux- und Cloud-Umfeld, im Bereich Kubernetes oder im Betrieb von Data Centern
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Transparenter und schneller Bewerbungsprozess mit einer verbindlichen Rückmeldung binnen 14 Tagen
Vertrauensvolle & persönliche Begleitung zu jeder Zeit – Partnerschaftlichkeit ist die Basis unserer Zusammenarbeit
Direkte Vermittlung in eine Festanstellung bei unserem Kundenunternehmen
Ortsungebunden und flexibel durch die Möglichkeit Remote zu arbeiten

Bewerben

Erkennen Sie sich wieder? Dann senden Sie Ihre Unterlagen unter Angabe der Kennziffer 221-4200 an Frau Kati Neubert. Erste Informationswünsche und Fragen beantwortet Ihnen Kati Neubert gern telefonisch unter +49 30 2014497-22. Wir freuen uns bald von Ihnen zu hören!

Title: C++ Software Engineer
text:
About us:

Protex AI is a VC-backed technology company building a privacy-preserving computer vision platform to enable proactive Health and Safety (EHS) workflows. We leverage the domain knowledge of EHS teams to help our computer vision system understand the concept of danger, preventing accidents before they occur. Every worker has the right to go home safe and healthy every day and every employer has the responsibility to provide a safe work environment. Our mission at Protex AI is to ensure that this is the case in every facility around the world by empowering EHS teams to adopt proactive safety cultures and in doing so realise an injury-free workplace.

Position Overview:

We are on the hunt for a multifaceted C++ Software Engineer with a solid background in UNIX system development and a flair for Python. The successful candidate will be responsible for optimising and building robust computer vision-based systems. Collaborating on AI-powered applications, and ensuring seamless integration from edge to cloud

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain software for UNIX-based systems using C++ and integrate with NVIDIA DeepStream for AI-driven insights.
Implement and optimise Python scripts to interface with C++ modules, ensuring smooth interoperability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Perform profiling on UNIX systems to identify bottlenecks and optimise performance.
Debug and enhance system stability and reliability.
Maintain thorough documentation on design, development, and profiling activities.
Stay abreast of the latest trends in C++, Python, and AI technologies like DeepStream.
Mentor team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.


Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience with C++ development for UNIX systems.
Proficiency in Python scripting and development.
Familiarity with UNIX system profiling tools and techniques.


Preferred Requirements:

Master's degree in a relevant field.
Hands-on experience with NVIDIA DeepStream SDK.
Familiarity with cloud systems e.g AWS, Azure etc.
Proven track record in optimising UNIX systems for performance and reliability.
Deep understanding of AI algorithms and pipelines.


Personal Attributes:

Strong analytical and problem-solving aptitude.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication capabilities.
Rigorous attention to detail and a relentless pursuit of quality.
Proactive and self-motivated approach to tasks and projects.


Protex AI is an inclusive and equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating an equitable workplace for everyone regardless of gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Title: Frontend Software Engineer for Whiteboards
Data Scientist - Application Developer - Remote
text:
At Cytel, we work hard to create successful careers with significant professional growth for our employees, as a result of which they work hard to make Cytel successful. Cytel is a place where talent, experience and integrity come together to advance the state of clinical development.




Lead one or more statistical programming study teams or application development projects. Responsible for project level programming or app development activities.




Major Responsibilities




Provide leadership, guidance, and hands-on support to d evelop data analysis solution for complex business problems in collaboration with biostatisticians and Statistical programmers e.g., R Shiny / Python web application
Ensure technical validity, compliance to standards and SOPs, regulatory requirements
Test, debug and optimize applications to ensure they work as expected, using both manual and automated testing techniques and provide documentation as perComputer System Assurance guidance
Develop and maintain deployment and configuration instructions and ensure performance, security, and scalability of deployed applications
Provide technical support to junior level programmers on day-to-day assigned activities




Required Education/Experience




Bachelor or Master of Science degree or equivalent in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science, or related field.
at least 6 years of programming experience 3+ for R, R Shiny for preferably in processing clinical trial data in the pharmaceutical industry
Advanced statistical computing software skills
Demonstrated programming experience and proficiency with R, R Shiny, tidyverse packages and R Markdown in building advanced R packages and modular Shiny apps (or other development stack)
Excellent knowledge of Good Programming Practices
Ability to perform, coordinate and oversee the preparation, execution, reporting and documentation of all programming deliverables of a project, with minimal supervision.
Strong project management skills




Cytel Inc. is an Equal Employment / Affirmative Action Employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristics protected by law.




Cytel does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Cytel’s human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Cytel. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Cytel. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Cytel. Cytel shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies.




#CYTELINT

Title: IT System Engineer - Internal Services (m/w/d)
text:
Digitalisierung – Made in Germany




plusserver ist ein führender deutscher Cloud-Provider mit der Plattform für die Digitalisierung „Made in Germany“. Schritt für Schritt begleiten wir Unternehmen und öffentliche Auftraggeber bei ihrer IT-Modernisierung. Dazu unterstützen wir die IT des Kunden mit unserem eigenen Produktportfolio: von innovativen Cloud-Services über Hosting bis hin zu Colocation. Dabei lässt sich die Bestands-IT der Kunden nahtlos in ein zukunftsfähiges Setup integrieren, wodurch eine IT-Transformation im eigenen Tempo ermöglicht wird. Zusätzlich können wir unsere eigenen Cloud-Produkte mit den Lösungen der Hyperscaler zu einer kundenzentrierten und gemanagten Multi-Cloud verbinden. Kunden bleiben somit anbieterunabhängig und erhalten darüber hinaus einen transparenten Entscheidungsrahmen über die Souveränität ihrer Daten.




Werde auch Du jetzt ein Teil von plusserver. Unterstütze die Digitalisierung unserer Kunden durch agile Entwicklungsmethoden, zukunftssichere Technologien und flexible Gestaltungsspielräume.




Zum nächstmöglichen Termin suchen wir in Vollzeit und unbefristet eine:n IT System Engineer - Internal Services. Bei uns kannst Du frei wählen, ob Du vollständig remote, hybrid oder vor Ort arbeiten möchtest. Unsere modernen Standorte befinden sich in Köln, Hamburg, Bielefeld und Dresden.




Worauf Du Dich bei uns freuen kannst




Ergänze unser starkes Team jetzt als IT System Engineer - Internal Services und gestalte mit uns Schritt für Schritt die IT-Welt von morgen.




Bei uns hast Du vielseitige Aufgaben – dazu gehört unter anderem auch der Aufbau und Betrieb interner Core-Services auf Basis unseres modernen Technologie- und Produktstacks (z. B. IDM, DNS, Syslog).




Des Weiteren gehören auch die fortwährende Weiterentwicklung der betriebenen Core Services hinsichtlich Performance und Verfügbarkeit sowie die Automatisierung von Aufbau- und Betriebsabläufen zu Deinem Aufgabengebiet.




Auch das Monitoring, die Fehleranalyse und Problemlösung im Rahmen interner Service Requests nimmst Du unter Deine Fittiche. Zudem wirkst Du an den agilen Zeremonien des Teams mit, in dem Du Deinen Ideen einbringst und nimmst nach ausführlicher Einarbeitung an der im Team rotierenden Rufbereitschaft teil.




Werde jetzt Teil eines Teams in dem jede:r zählt und erhalte von uns die Gelegenheit Dich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten. Zusätzlich unterstützen wir Dich durch eine intensive Einarbeitung und Schulungsmöglichkeiten bei Deiner fachlichen Weiterentwicklung.




Was uns überzeugt




Deine Persönlichkeit Gepaart Mit




einer abgeschlossenen technisch orientierten Berufsausbildung im IT-Bereich (z.B. Fachinformatiker:in Systemintegration oder vergleichbares), idealerweise erster Berufserfahrung im IT-Sektor
sehr guten Kenntnissen in Linux Serveradministration
einem agilen Mindset und Spaß an der Arbeit mit den neusten Technologien
solide Erfahrungen mit üblichen Netzwerkdiensten und Protokollen
sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Was ist ein Plus (aber keine Voraussetzung):




Kenntnisse Windows Serveradministration
Erfahrungen mit hochverfügbaren Setups (Linux HA-Services wie Pacemaker, Microsoft Clusterservices, Loadbalancing)
gute Kenntnisse in Scriptsprachen (Bash, Python)
Erfahrungen im Config-Management und Automatisierung




Darauf kannst Du zählen




Für jede:n einzelne:n bei plusserver bietet der stetige IT-Wandel die Möglichkeit, mit den neuesten Technologien in Kontakt zu sein, sich stetig weiterzuentwickeln und die Zukunft von plusserver sowie die unserer Kunden aktiv mitzugestalten. Dank eines agilen Arbeitsumfeldes, flacher Hierarchien, großer Freiräume der Arbeits- und Zeiteinteilung, einer Duz-Kultur, einer direkten Kommunikation und offenen Feedbackkultur kann bei uns jede:r ihr/sein volles Potenzial entfalten.




Zudem Bieten Wir Dir Diese Und Weitere Vorteile




hervorragende Zukunftsperspektiven und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten
große Gestaltungsfreiräume für Deine Ideen und Dein Engagement
eine strukturierte Einarbeitung in Dein Aufgabenfeld auf Augenhöhe mit Deinen Kolleg:innen
fortwährende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in unserer plusacademy und mit Udemy for Business
30 Tage Urlaub sowie weitere firmenweite Wellbeing-Tage
flexible Arbeitszeiten, monatliche Meeting-free Fridays und Homeoffice-Regelungen für eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance
Förderung Deiner körperlichen Fitness durch eine vergünstigte Mitgliedschaft beim Urban Sports Club mit hunderten Live- und Video-Sportkursen
attraktive Konditionen bei vielen Produkten und Dienstleistungen durch unser Corporate-Benefits-Programm
sehr viele schöne Momente bei regelmäßigen Firmenveranstaltungen und Teamevents – ob live oder digital
hybrides Arbeiten mit einer technischen Ausstattung des Heimarbeitsplatzes wie im Büro
modern eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit sehr guten ÖPNV-Anbindungen
ein nutzungsbezogenes Erstattungskonzept für Fahrt- und Parkkosten sowie ein Fahrradleasing-Angebot




So erreichst Du uns




Du erreichst Julia unter +49 2203 1045 7453 oder via Mail unter julia.wrobel@plusserver.com.

Title: Data Analyst: Training and Project Work (remote -part-time)- Get hands on work experience with real startup projects
text:
The program is flexible, part-time, and fully remote. Program language – English

If you are a student, graduate or career change aspirant, currently looking for an internship or a job as Data Analyst or work experience in a startup, this is for you.

– Cover letter preparation

– Interview tips

Title: Software Test Engineer (w/m/d) Embedded Systems - Remote möglich
text:
Ihre Leidenschaft ist die Automobilbranche und Sie haben Erfahrung im Testen von Software? Dann kommen Sie in unser Team und unterstützen unseren Kunden in Kerpen als Software Testingenieur (m/w/d).




Ihre Aufgaben




In Ihrer neuen Aufgabe sind Sie für die Absicherung der Software von hochintegrierten Motorwechselrichtern für den Einsatz im Automobil zuständig

Zudem implementieren Sie manuelle sowie automatisierte Testfällen auf Software-Systemebene und führen diese durch
Sie analysieren und dokumentieren Testergebnisse bzw. Fehlerbilder

Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Elektrotechnik, Informatik oder vergleichbare fachliche Ausbildung
Darüber hinaus bringen Sie Berufserfahrung im Bereich Software Entwicklung oder Test automobiler Anwendungen mit
Sie haben fundierte Kenntnisse der Programmiersprache CAPL und C/C++ sowie gute Kenntnisse automotiver Netzwerke (CAN, LIN) und serieller Schnittstellen
Erfahrungen mit Entwicklungswerkzeugen für Software-Tests im automotiven Umfeld (z.B. Vector CANoe, CANape, vTESTstudio) runden Ihr Profil ab

Spannende Projekte
Internationale und renommierte Kunden
Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in unseren internationalen technischen Büros
Tarifliche Vergütung
Unbefristetes Anstellungsverhältnis
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten (Akkodis Academy)
Teamevents

bochum@akkodis.com
